title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and emergencies under the "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002." The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services during disasters or emergencies declared by the President or when the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The Secretary has the authority to offer care to veterans regardless of their enrollment status and can prioritize this care over other services. The Secretary has the authority to offer care to veterans regardless of their enrollment status and can prioritize this care over other services. Care and services under this section are prioritized for certain groups, including veterans with service-connected disabilities and members of the Armed Forces on active duty receiving health-care services under a specific section. Reimbursement for care or services provided to federal government officers or employees from other departments or agencies is determined by agreed-upon rates between the Secretary and the head of the respective department or agency. The Secretary can provide care and services during disasters or emergencies, with reimbursement rates agreed upon with other departments. Amounts received are credited to the Department facility providing care. A report must be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs within 60 days of the disaster. A report must be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs within 60 days of the disaster. The Secretary shall prescribe regulations governing the exercise of this authority. During major disasters and medical emergencies, charges for emergency care may be waived, except as provided in section 1711A of the title. Members of the Armed Forces are covered during periods of war or national emergencies involving armed conflict. During disasters or emergencies, the Secretary may provide hospital care and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces. This includes major disasters declared by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. The Secretary may prioritize providing care and services under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act to active duty members during disasters or emergencies. This includes situations where the National Disaster Medical System is activated. The terms 'hospital care', 'nursing home care', and 'medical services' are defined in this section.
